comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Pre 1891 - No Hentsch Bond around the Lord Nelson Hotel.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: There is no listing in 1888 Sands (compiled 1887) for the Royal Oak (est. 1837) in Millers Point (but there are five others in other areas of Sydney). A search of Trove reveals that by June 1882, John Sottero was operating a fish & chip shop, or rather, a fish and oyster saloon from the premises - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/28380580 . Originally from Greece, he was naturalised in January of the following year. - srwww.records.nsw.gov.au/indexsearch/searchhits.aspx?tabl...

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Possibly before June 1882, however ... the Royal Oak name on the side wall could be a remanent, and may have remained there for some time after it finished trading as the Royal Oak. In Shirley Fitzgerald's Millers Point book, there is a photo showing the Royal Oak with the name emblazoned on the upper front of the building, which isn't there in this photo. So the photo may indeed be after 1882. Hmmn ...

comment._content:
